title: Post-9/11 GI Bill (Chapter 33)
description: Provides up to 36 months of education benefits, including full in-state public college tuition, a monthly housing allowance, and an annual books stipend for veterans who served after Sept 10, 2001.

application.instructions: Submit VA Form 22-1990 (Application for Education Benefits) online through VA's eBenefits portal or at a VA Regional Office. Once issued a Certificate of Eligibility, enroll at an approved institution. Main resource: https://www.va.gov/education/about-gi-bill-benefits/post-9-11/

title: VA Health Care Enrollment
description: Comprehensive healthcare services through VA medical facilities, including preventive care, inpatient/outpatient services, mental health care, prescriptions, and specialty programs.

application.instructions: Enroll for VA health care by submitting VA Form 10-10EZ online, by mail, or in person at a VA medical center. Enrollment can also be done via phone (1-877-222-VETS). Main resource: https://www.va.gov/health-care/eligibility/

underutilizedReason: Only about half of eligible veterans are enrolled in VA health care. Many are unaware of their eligibility, prefer private insurance, or had past negative experiences.
